intro: Euploca campestris, commonly known as the field euploca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Euploca campestris is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty and windy conditions.
